member.name: F:WinDocking.Docking.DockPane._lastParentWindow
member.summary: There's a bug in the WinForms layout engine that can result in a deferred layout to not properly clear out the cached layout args after the layout operation is performed. Specifically, this bug is hit when the bounds of the Pane change, initiating a layout on the parent (DockWindow) which is where the bug hits. To work around it, when a pane loses the DockWindow as its parent, that parent DockWindow needs to perform a layout to flush the cached args, if they exist.

member.name: P:WinDocking.Docking.DockPaneCaptionBase.CanDragAutoHide
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether dock panel can be dragged when in auto hide mode. Default is false.

member.name: P:WinDocking.Docking.DockPanel.DockBackColor
member.summary: Determines the color with which the client rectangle will be drawn. If this property is used instead of the BackColor it will not have any influence on the borders to the surrounding controls (DockPane). The BackColor property changes the borders of surrounding controls (DockPane). Alternatively both properties may be used (BackColor to draw and define the color of the borders and DockBackColor to define the color of the client rectangle). For Backgroundimages: Set your prefered Image, then set the DockBackColor and the BackColor to the same Color (Control)

member.name: P:WinDocking.Docking.DockPanel.DockArea
member.summary: Dock area.
member.remarks:
This is the center rectangle of control.
Excluded spaces are for the following visual elements, * Auto hide strips on four sides. * Necessary paddings defined in themes.
Therefore, all dock contents mainly fall into this area (except auto hide window, which might slightly move beyond this area).

member.name: P:WinDocking.Docking.DockPanel.ShowAutoHideContentOnHover
member.summary: Flag to show autohide content on mouse hover. Default value is true.
member.remarks: This flag is ignored in VS2012/2013 themes. Such themes assume it is always false.

member.name: T:WinDocking.Docking.DockPanel.DragHandlerBase
member.summary: DragHandlerBase is the base class for drag handlers. The derived class should: 1. Define its public method BeginDrag. From within this public BeginDrag method, DragHandlerBase.BeginDrag should be called to initialize the mouse capture and message filtering. 2. Override the OnDragging and OnEndDrag methods.

member.remarks: The stream is closed after deserialization.

member.summary: Loads layout from a stream.
member.param: The flag to close the stream after deserialization.

member.name: T:WinDocking.Docking.DeserializeDockContent
member.summary: Deserialization handler of layout file/stream.
member.remarks:
The deserialization handler method should handle all possible exceptions.
If any exception happens during deserialization and is not handled, the program might crash or experience other issues.
